topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5592d45463687213fe0006c0#post_5592d45463687213fe0006c0
[bq="uc9"]I was reading the news like I always do and I thought of something: considering how the world is getting to be a better place in say 50 years we're probably going to have people complaining about how it's "too nice of a place to live".

24/7 news is designed for people that want the spectacle of disaster rather than be informative.

What I mean by this is in the usa birth rates for the first time have gone up because 30+ year olds are having children again whereas teenage pregnancy is falling off a cliff and unplanned pregnancy is falling as well.  Call me crazy, but I have a feeling in say 10-15 years we're probably going to see people going "I miss how teens were constantly getting pregnant and marrying out of wedlock!  Times were better back then!  We didn't have any of this planned pregnancy by parents that can financially support their children!  We had rampant stds as well!  We're living in a sinful world with their low teenage pregnancy rates and low std rate!"[/bq]
I've always wondered this kind of thing
A world so nice, it almost gets boring
But that's why we have fictional media to show give us unpleasant stuff
topics.author: 4fe3df367f123b517900066a
